div.p: INTERACT with FOR one's SELF:own AIMS.
1. The current general word is yòng 用 (ant. fèi 廢 "give up the use of, not use").
2. Yǐ 以 refers to the use of things as instruments for a given purpose and rarely involves the using up of resources.
3. Shǐ 使 refers to the deployment of what one controls with no special emphasis on the purpose.
4. Jiā 加 refers to the deployment or application of something in the course of some action.
rough draft to BEGIN TO identify synonym group members for analysis, based on CL etc. 18.11.2003. CH ／

bibl.title: A Dictionary of Selected Synonyms in the Principal Indo-European Languages

note.p: 225. Inter Frui et uti haec distinctio est. Quod fruimur quo nequaquam carere possumus; utimur quae aliquando nec semper habemus. Ac per hoc uti temporale est, frui vero aeternum.
uti refers to the permanent or lasting use of something.
usurpare refers to a momentary single act of using.
frui is antiquated and refers to a lasting use and enjoyment of something desirable.

bibl.title: Anthologia sive Florilegium rerum et materiarum selectarum

sense.def: CAUSE TO ENGAGE IN ACTION> deploy (horses in battle); use (one's strength); set to work (people)

entry.def: Yǐ 以 refers to the use of things as instruments for a given purpose and rarely involves the using up of resources.

sense.def: =所以：e.g. 無以知人 "does not that by which to understand men": that whereby, that wherewith

e.g. 以顯父母 "in this way make the parents illustrious": using this means> by this means> in this way; with the contextually determinate object, by use of the contextually determinate object/method (the pronominal object of the preposition is omitted)
to V using (oneself)
by means of V-ing
using as an instrument> e.g. 以卵投石 "dash a stone with an egg" by means of, with
e.g. 以孔子之聖 "even if one has the (superb) sagacity of a Confucius": even if using> although one has and uses
以己度人"using oneself to measure others" using (oneself)> with one's own things, by one's own standards
e.g. 道之以德 "guide them through virtue": To V by using> by means of N; with
e.g. 文王以百里 "King Wen (became a great king) with one hundred leagues square": using> with (something) (perform a contextually determinate action or behaviour)
e.g. 不以目而以心 "not use they eyes but use the mind": make use of; make proper or meaningful use of
e.g. 以身教 "instruct through one's own person" using one's own person
e.g. 山以之高 "the mountains are high by virtue of it" by virtue of npro
e.g. 以鞿羈 "use (the cultivation of beauty) as my bridle and reins": use something contextually determinate N1 as one's N2
e.g. 勉主以禮義 "encourge the ruler by meanins of ritual propriety and righteousness": by means of
e.g. 以此規 "apply these rules": apply; implement
e.g. 禮以行之 "using ritual propriety to put things into practice": using the preceding N to V
e.g. 以近知遠 "basing oneself on the near understand the distant": making intellectual use of; basing oneself on
e.g. 處之以遵道 'to deal with them by following the right way'': to V2 by V1-ing
得之以強 "become strong by gaining it": to V1 by V2-ing

gramGrp.tls:sem-feat: postnominal instrumental, N and N coreferential

sense.def: using the N to V
make use of

entry.def: Shǐ 使 refers to the deployment of what one controls with no special emphasis on the purpose.

sense.def: use
use (what is not one's due)
avail oneself of, use (what is not one's own)

entry.def: Jiā 加 refers to the deployment or application of something in the course of some action.

sense.def: apply N2 to N1 賞不加於無功
use something contextually determinate N1 on or against (N2)
apply (a method, course of action etc N1) (to an object N2) 加之兵
use (something N1) on (a goal N2) 加兵於齊 HN: 不能將加誅於子
be brought to bear on, be put to use on
be used; be set into action (cf: 兵之所加 – Whenever an army is used)
deploy vigorously
deploy (oneself), exert (oneself); use (one's own) energies
employ an abstract object (e.g. lenient approach)
emphasise the use of, pay special attention to the use of
use; GUAN apparently: use and take along
1. (of emperors or highly elevated persons) make use of
apply, dispense (medicine etc)
using N to V
using the contextually determinate N to V
exercise (of power) over N; use of N (probably ad hoc nominalisation, not really lexicalised. Must be deleted in the end, but can be kept as an example of the kind of thing we do not need. C.H.)
deploy; make proficient use of; make practical use of (e.g. a scaling ladder); exercise

CHEMLA 2003: apply effectively to something else (by way of generalisation)JZ 9.3, Liu Hui 掇 comm: 將以施于諸率。故先具此術以見其源也 "(The canon) is designed to effectively apply this method to all lyu-triangles (or lyu-procedures). Therefore it first provides this procedure in order then to bring out into the open the source (from which all these lyu spring)."
use the contextually determinate N1 for use on N2
use, deploy (weapons, armies, vehicles)

entry.def: The current general word is yòng 用 (ant. fèi 廢 "give up the use of, not use")

sense.def: used, expended 用力 "effort expended"
be useable
using the contextually determinate N to V
make use of (with contextually determinate object)
have use for
use N so as to V
using, by the use of, making use of
make use of; use (an object as an instrument); use to one's benefit; apply
use (advice etc.) so as to act in accordance with it > follow
be used; be employed/manifested; be put to use, be put into practice; be used up
make use of (oneself)
use one's own resources/oneself; deploy one's own person
have use for
use N1 on N2; apply N1 to N2
using N, with N (接人用枻)
use N1 on N2; apply N1 to N2
use the understood N so as to V
introduce the use use of, start using
their/its function(s); their practical use; their practical application
using (mostly negated)
deploy, use (military force) 稱兵
deploy (arms etc)
use the contextually determinate N and go ahead to V
use the contextually determinate object in any way
using, making use of
by means of, using

use N1 as N2, make use of as
use, function (> activity), advantage
the means by which N V-s
what the contextually determinate N uses to V; the means by which N V-s

to V using N (synonymous with 以)
the use of something
make use of, deploy; put into practice

availing oneself of N (to V)
avail oneself of N1 from the source N2
use a whole lot of (should probably be vtoNm）
use N, make use of N
use N2 as N1; treat2 as N1
